column4: ok, so now I know what it is, how can I get the center speaker to work?
sounds like you got things hooked up wrong because it should just work.
I didn't hook anything up, I just installed from a CD
it's the same if I install debian, too
speakers have to be hooked up
it's a laptop
I see.
the speakers are built in
there's a sub-woofer on the bottom of the case
nice, what kind of laptop is this?
it's http://www.funponsel.com/blog/archives/2006/06/24/asus-w1j-laptop-with-integrated-tv-tuner/
do as they are saying, make sure alsa is installed and working properly, make sure its enabled if its already installed.
sounds heavy
it's quite light.  the case is carbon fibre I think
nice :)
both left and right speakers work with alsa, esd, arts, oss or whatever else I try.  but the volume control is labelled 'front', rather than 'pcm' which I'm used to seeing on other installs
the fact that it knows there's a "front" speaker makes me think it's somehow just got it's "wires crossed"
could be but I bet its something funny like how you got the speakers confiqured
I've not got the speakers configured - they're inside the case, and I can't get to them at all
naw, how you have them confiqured in linux, I bet you need ti enabe full duplex and surround sound.
heh, ok, I'll do that then.
try like rain said, that should force alsa
